Kaplan | influenced = | contributions = Real Business Cycle Theory Time consistency in economic policy | alma_mater = Norwegian School of Economics (BSc) Carnegie Mellon University (PhD) | repec_prefix = e | repec_id = pky2 }} Finn Erling Kydland (born 1 December 1943) is a Norwegian economist. He is known for his contributions to business cycle theory. He is the Henley Professor of Economics at the University of California, Santa Barbara. Kydland was a co-recipient of the 2004 Nobel Prize in Economics, with Edward C. Prescott, "for their contributions to dynamic macroeconomics: the time consistency of economic policy and the driving forces behind business cycles." ==References== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:Norwegian scientists
